00048 #define RADIO_CHIP_FAMILY_EZRADIO       1u

00056 /* Question: How to use my own radio configuration header file?
00057  *
00058  * Answer (Simplicity Studio): Simply open the bundled radio configurator
00059  * located in the RadioConfig source group. Whenever a new header file
00060  * is generated the project will reconfigure itself to use the generated
00061  * instead of the default.
00062  * If one is to go back to use the default radio header file, the
00063  * RADIO_USE_GENERATED_CONFIGURATION macro should be removed (or set to 0)
00064  * under the 'Path and Symbols' menu in the 'Properties' of the project.
00065  *
00066  * Answer (Other development tool: Add the following definition to your project
00067  * in order to use your own generated radio configuration header file, instead
00068  * of the kit default one.
00069  * #define RADIO_USE_GENERATED_CONFIGURATION
00070  */
00071 
00072 #if ( (defined RADIO_USE_GENERATED_CONFIGURATION) && (RADIO_USE_GENERATED_CONFIGURATION == 1) )
00073 /* Include the generated radio configuration */
00074 #include "radio-config-wds-gen.h"
00075 #else
00076 /* Include the default radio configuration for the board */
00077 #if   ( (defined SL_WSTK6200A) || (defined SL_WSTK6220A) )
00078 #include "radio-config-wds-gen_R60-868MHz-13dBm.h"
00079 #elif   (defined SL_WSTK6240A)
00080 #include "radio-config-wds-gen_R61-868MHz-16dBm.h"
00081 #elif ( (defined SL_WSTK6201A) || (defined SL_WSTK6221A) || (defined SL_WSTK6241A) )
00082 #include "radio-config-wds-gen_R55-434MHz-10dBm.h"
00083 #elif ( (defined SL_WSTK6202A) || (defined SL_WSTK6222A) || (defined SL_WSTK6242A) )
00084 #include "radio-config-wds-gen_R63-915MHz-20dBm.h"
00085 #elif ( (defined SL_WSTK6223A) || (defined SL_WSTK6243A) )
00086 #include "radio-config-wds-gen_R63-490MHz-20dBm.h"
00087 #elif ( (defined SL_WSTK6224A) || (defined SL_WSTK6244A)  )
00088 #include "radio-config-wds-gen_R63-169MHz-20dBm.h"
00089 #else
00090 #error No radio configuration is defined! Create your own radio configuration or define your kit properly!
00091 #endif
00092 #endif
00093

00121 // Error code definitions of EZRadioDrv
00122 #define ECODE_EMDRV_EZRADIODRV_OK                       ( ECODE_OK )                                   ///< Success return value.
00123 #define ECODE_EMDRV_EZRADIODRV_ILLEGAL_HANDLE           ( ECODE_EMDRV_EZRADIODRV_BASE | 0x00000001 )   ///< Illegal SPI handle.
00124 
00125 #define ECODE_EMDRV_EZRADIODRV_TRANSMIT_PLUGIN_BASE             ( ECODE_EMDRV_EZRADIODRV_BASE | 0x00000100 )   ///< Transmit plugin base error code.
00126 #define ECODE_EMDRV_EZRADIODRV_RECEIVE_PLUGIN_BASE              ( ECODE_EMDRV_EZRADIODRV_BASE | 0x00000200 )   ///< Receive plugin base error code.
00127 #define ECODE_EMDRV_EZRADIODRV_CRC_ERROR_PLUGIN_BASE            ( ECODE_EMDRV_EZRADIODRV_BASE | 0x00000300 )   ///< CRC error plugin base error code.
00128 #define ECODE_EMDRV_EZRADIODRV_AUTO_ACK_PLUGIN_BASE             ( ECODE_EMDRV_EZRADIODRV_BASE | 0x00000400 )   ///< Receive plugin base error code.
00129 #define ECODE_EMDRV_EZRADIODRV_UNMOD_CARRIER_PLUGIN_BASE        ( ECODE_EMDRV_EZRADIODRV_BASE | 0x00000500 )   ///< Receive plugin base error code.
00130 #define ECODE_EMDRV_EZRADIODRV_PN9_PLUGIN_BASE                  ( ECODE_EMDRV_EZRADIODRV_BASE | 0x00000600 )   ///< Receive plugin base error code.
00131 #define ECODE_EMDRV_EZRADIODRV_DIRECT_TRANSMIT_PLUGIN_BASE      ( ECODE_EMDRV_EZRADIODRV_BASE | 0x00000700 )   ///< Transmit plugin base error code.
00132 #define ECODE_EMDRV_EZRADIODRV_DIRECT_RECEIVE_PLUGIN_BASE       ( ECODE_EMDRV_EZRADIODRV_BASE | 0x00000800 )   ///< Receive plugin base error code.

00218

00230 #define EZRADIO_LENGTH_WORD_START     (RADIO_CONFIG_DATA_FIELD1_LENGTH + RADIO_CONFIG_DATA_FIELD2_LENGTH + RADIO_CONFIG_DATA_FIELD3_LENGTH)
00231 
00232 #endif // RADIO_CONFIGURATION_DATA_PKT_FIELD_CONTAINING_LENGTH

00249 
00250 #elif  (RADIO_CONFIGURATION_DATA_PKT_VARIABLE_LENGTH_FIELD  == 4)

00260 /* Note: Neither EZRADIO_LENGTH_WORD_START or EZRADIO_VARIABLE_DATA_START is defined, so application knows
00261  *       that incoming data starts at the really beginning of the packet.  */
00262 #endif //#if ( (defined RADIO_CONFIGURATION_DATA_PKT_VARIABLE_PACKET_LENGTH_ENABLE ) && (RADIO_CONFIGURATION_DATA_PKT_VARIABLE_PACKET_LENGTH_ENABLE  > 0) )

00323 #endif

00347   EZRADIODRV_TRANSMIT_PLUGIN_INIT_DEFAULT         /* Tx plugin init */        \
